title: Sri Lanka to deploy military for funeral of slain protestor
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka will deploy the military from today to the area where the funeral of a protestor shot dead by the policy will be held on April 22, a government statement said.
K B Chaminda Lakshan, a father of two was shot dead by police during a protest over fuel shortages and a price hike, in Ramukkana, Sri Lanka.

Under powers vested in President Gotabaya Rajapaksa under the Public Security Ordinance, the tri-forces have been called into maintain order in the Kegalle district from April 21 to April 23, the statement said.

The three forces will assist police in the areas of Devalagama, Rmbukkana and Kegalle Police areas. Sri Lanka’s Police Chief C D Wickremaratne had asked Defence Secretary to deploy the three forces, the statement said.
Wickremaratne had ordered Deputy Inspector General W Tillekeratne to conduct an inquiry. He had also asked the criminal investigation department to give an interim report in three days.
Separately Sri Lanka’s Human Rights Commission in conducting an inquiry.
The President of Sri Lanka’s Bar Association Saliya Pieris informed the Human Rights Commission that he had information that police are intimidating witnesses not to give the correct evidence.
